actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-829, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5110 with 4 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Bill is closed to amendments. All points of order against the bill and against its consideration shall be waived. Pursuant to sec. 151(d) of the Trade Act of 1974, after general debate the Committee shall rise and report the bill to the House.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 240.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 298 - 123 (Roll no. 492).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5110) to approve and implement the trade agreements concluded in the Uruguay Round of multilateral trade negotiations.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 5110 (GATT approval and implementation).

titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5110) to approve and implement the trade agreements concluded in the Uruguay Round of multilateral trade negotiations.
